title: 27.3 Multithreaded Merge Sort
content:
Section 27.3

Multithreaded Merge Sort

Summary

Parallel merge sort with parallel merge operation.

Key Points

  • Parallel merge: use binary search to split merge in half
  • P-MERGE-SORT: spawn on both halves, parallel merge
  • Work: T₁ = Θ(n log n)
  • Span: T∞ = Θ(log³ n)
  • Parallelism: Θ(n/log² n) - sublinear in n

Pseudocode

P-MERGE-SORT(A, p, r, B, s):
    n = r - p + 1
    if n == 1: B[s] = A[p]
    else:
        T = new array[n]
        q = (p + r) / 2
        spawn P-MERGE-SORT(A, p, q, T, 1)
        P-MERGE-SORT(A, q+1, r, T, q-p+2)
        sync
        P-MERGE(T, 1, q-p+1, q-p+2, n, B, s)

Why It Matters

Practical parallel sorting with good theoretical guarantees.
